status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7glbc","text":"Thaw matrigel   on ice inside a   fridge. Chill all flasks, pipettes and materials to be used for flask preparation under the same conditions and keep everything as cold as possible throughout the procedure (do not use a freezer as it can cause the matrigel solution to freeze while platting).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erpm6","text":"Dilute matrigel in cold DMEM/F12 as described by the manufacturer and add into the T75 flasks (~ /flask total volume). Incubate at   for at least   before use. Flasks can be stored in the incubator for several weeks before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":96,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":131,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":146,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5fc3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"44g51","text":"Prepare PDL (0.5 µg/ml) in sterile water and add it to each well and incubate   to   at  . The day after, wash each well 4 times with sterile water to remove excess PDL (at this point the plates are ready to be used for culture - do not let the wells dry at any step as it can cause PDL crystallization (cytotoxic)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":83,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8itqu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":21600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ecoqj","text":"The below media recipes are used in the remainder of the protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"792fk","text":"STEP2 media: StemPro-34 SFM media + 2 mM GlutaMAX + 80 ng/ml VEGF, 25 ng/ml FGF + 100 ng/ml SCF","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"27vdt","text":"STEP3 media: StemPro-34 SFM media + 50 ng/ml SCF + 50 ng/ml IL-3 + 5 ng/ml TPO + 50 ng/ul M-CSF + 50 ng/ul Flt3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frihe","text":"STEP4 media: StemPro-34 SFM media + 50 ng/ml SCF + 50 ng/ml IL-3 + 5 ng/ml TPO + 50 ng/ul M-CSF + 50 ng/ul Flt3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bsbh","text":"Microglia maturation media: Neurobasal media + N2 Neuroplex (1x final concentration) + GEM21 Neuroplex (1x final concentration) + 20% AlbuMAX I (0.2% final concentration) + NaCl (5M) (50mM final concentration) + sodium pyruvate 100x (1x final concentration) + glutaMAX 100x (1x final concentration) + Penicillin-Streptomycin (100U/ml) + 50 ng/ml TGF-β1 + 100 ng/ml  IL-34 + 12.5 ng/ml  M-CSF","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7qog","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rq90","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9c0g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4fehs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7570i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"evj16","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5csf5","text":"Manually dissect undifferentiated hPSC colonies and transfer 40-60 small aggregates into a matrigel coated flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":46,"offset":125}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":46,"offset":125,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"key":"bethg","text":"It is important to start the differentiation from pristine, undifferentiated feeder free cultures. For more details consult: https://doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.b4mcqu2w ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"98951419AFE311EE952C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.b4mcqu2w"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bci9h","text":"When changing media in the flasks, avoid scraping the bottom surface of the flasks to prevent cell and coating loss. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eedte","text":"Maintain undifferentiated cells in mTeSR media until undifferentiated colonies reach an average colony size of 1 mm. Usually,   of media/flask and media change every other day works well to maintain the cells until they reach the right size. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":126,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5jeef","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"7","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rn6k","text":"STEP1 (days 0-3): Once the hPSC colonies reach the correct size, microglia differentiation is initiated (day 0) by culturing the undifferentiated cells in  of STEP1 media. STEP1 media should be replaced with fresh media on day 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":155,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"du1n3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmhqa","text":"STEP2 (days 4-5): Culture cells in   of STEP2 media. No media change until the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fipmk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bf0n2","text":"STEP3 (days 6-13): Culture cells in   of STEP3 media. Media should be changed on day 10.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9v0e0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rhve","text":"STEP4 (days 14-28): Culture cells in   of STEP4 media. Media should be replaced every  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"osg3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mbs2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":345600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Microglia precursor isolation and platting for maturation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dvpd8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7smjf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d53tk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4g1c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7c17u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9q770","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a6kmo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"audr5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3j2op","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mn5i","text":"Once microglia precursor differentiation is validated on day 28 or later, microglia progenitors are collected from STEP4 flasks by transferring the supernatant to a conical tube followed by   centrifugation at   for  . The cell pellet is resuspended in  microglia maturation media and plated at 75k cells/cm2 (Primaria or PDL-coated plates) in microglia maturation media. Media should be changed every 4 days for at least 2 weeks to allow the cells to mature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":210,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":216,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6js88","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3339q","text":"The timepoint of microglial precursor generation as indicated by the appearance of a large number of floating cells with microglial precursor typical morphology in the supernatant is variable between hPSC cell lines and starts usually around day 28 of differentiation. Microglia precursor differentiation can be validated  by FACS analysis (described in another protocol in this same collection). We normally only initiate microglial differentiation from cultures with more than 80% CD11b/CD45 and CD14/CD16 double positive microglial precursors.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d2sqh","text":"If properly maintained with STEP4 media changes every 4 days, cultures  in STEP4 are capable of generating microglia precursors for several months (as monitored by FACS). Microglia precursors can be collected every 4 days for microglial maturation as described below. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":255},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":328},{"key":2,"length":1,"offset":334},{"key":3,"length":1,"offset":377}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"14ti6","text":"For media changes in STEP4 on days without collecting microglial precursors for maturation (as described below), we usually try to return microglial precursors after media change. Because microglia precursor cells grow mainly in suspension,  we collect  ~  of microglial containing supernatant in a conical tube, centrifuged at   for  , and subsequently resuspend the cells in   of fresh STEP4 media to return to the same flask.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1mehq","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"centrifuge":"150","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":1324},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"centrifuge"},"2":{"data":{"duration":240,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"},"3":{"data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"apnqo","text":"Microglial precursors can be plated on either Primaria plates or Poly-D-Lysine (PDL) coated cell culture plates or glass cover slips. However, based on our experience, platting on primaria plates results in more consistent differentiation to mature microglia. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"4":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"150","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":1324}},"5":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":240,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

title: Microglia differentiation
